questions.question_text: What is the default URL of the OCR server that runs the Computer Vision service?

discussion.content:
B makes the most sense given the context of ReFramework and Linear processes. The Get Transaction Item state is ALWAYS going to execute at least once. There are 3 conditions or triggers associated with each state: Success, SystemException and BusinessRuleException. 

In the best case-scenario, it will be successful and return back to the get transaction item state, because it is a linear process, the state will transition to the final state to end the process. Since with linear process, only one set of data can be worked on at a time.

B
it needs enter second times and get Nothing to End Process

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct on

choices.D: Until there are no more queue items left unprocessed in Orchestrator.
choices.C: The process will not enter the Get Transaction Data state because a linear process is not transactional.

questions.question_text: In the context of a linear process, implemented with REFramework, how many times will the process enter the Get Transaction Data state?

comments.content: It is a business exception. It involves a human error in this case. It has nothing to do with system or application. System exception becomes an application exception in orchestrator. Both options have been made available in this case.

discussion.content: B is correct. Business Exceptions contain applicable data however, that data does not meet business requirements and a customized exception is thrown.

questions.question_text:
A project built using REFramework pulls phone numbers from a database of employees and creates queue items for each one. Following processing, these elements must be added to a financing application. The queue item holding a phone number becomes invalid if a digit is accidentally left out because of a human mistake. As a requirement, queue items that contain partial numbers should not be accepted.
What type of error should be thrown according to best practices?

choices.A: Navigate to Tenant > Folders, click the Personal Workspaces tab, and then click Manage Resources for the desired workspace.
choices.B: Navigate to Tenant > Folders, click the All Workspaces tab, and then click Check Resources for the desired workspace.
choices.C: Navigate to Tenant > Users, click the Personal Workspaces tab, and then click Resources for the desired workspace.
choices.D: Navigate to Tenant > Folders, click the Personal Workspaces tab, and then click See Usage for the desired workspace.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Per the documentation, it is D

Selected Answer: D
Per the documentation, it is D.

Selected Answer: D
I Think correct answer is D 
according to the Documentation
 https://docs.uipath.com/orchestrator/automation-cloud/latest/user-guide/managing-personal-workspaces

questions.question_text: Starting with UiPath Studio version 2022.10, what happens to dependencies that lack Windows compatibility when they are converted in a project?

choices.A: They are removed from the project.
choices.C: They are replaced with compatible alternatives.
